text: Penang Bridge is a major bridge in Malaysia that connects Penang Island to the mainland. It was opened in 1985 and is one of the longest bridges in Southeast Asia. The bridge was built during the leadership of Malaysia's Prime Minister, Mahathir Mohamad, who played a key role in its development. The bridge helps improve transportation and supports economic growth in the region. ==References== Category:1985 establishments in Asia Category:1980s establishments in Malaysia Category:Bridges in Malaysia Category:Penang Category:Mahathir Mohamad
title: Penang Bridge
